sim.description: NASA Space Shuttle Atlantis in a free-fly test
sim.long-description: The Space Shuttle was a partially re-usable low orbit spacecraft operated by NASA from 1981 to 2011. Prior to the spaceflight program, NASA conducted a series of free-fly tests with the Shuttle dropped from the back of a 747 at about 36.000 ft - this scenario simulates such a test with the altitude worth about five minutes of flight.
